history.text: Hi! So how did you like Iron Man?
I liked it a lot! I love superhero movies! How about you?
Same here!  I loved it! I completely agree with CinemaScore's rating of A . So who was your favorite character?
I would have to say it was a tossup between Robert Downey Jr. or Terrence Howard. Hbu?
*How about you?
I would say Robert Downey Jr's portrayal of Tony Stark and Iron Man was my favorite although the entire cast did a wonderful job. Even Jeff Bridges was wonderful as the shady Obadiah Stane!
I totally agree with the reviewers about the greatness of the special effects. How did you like them?
I'm like you: I agree as well. It truly was an expansively entertaining special effects extravaganza! Do you feel Rotten Tomatoes and CinemaScore's ratings were accurate?
Well I think that both scores should've been higher! I would say around mid-80s what do you think about the scoring?

I felt an A score and 94% were about right for this film I suppose. I disagreed with the critic who said it had a slightly depressed, going through the motions feel. It's like what movie did he watch? Ha!
Yea like how harsh can you get!
I thought Robert Downey Jr. Looked great in this film!

So true! I loved the beginning when they demonstrated the new Jericho missle! Although the convoy ambush that followed was unexpected! I felt sorry for Tony after one of his own weapons critically wounded him.
How much did you pay for your ticket to see this movie?
I can't honestly say. So did you feel Raza would keep his word about freeing Tony if he constructed a Jericho missile for him? I felt Tony did the right thing by believing Raza wouldnt keep his word.
Same like why else would you want a missile! I would be totally skeptical!
Agreed! Well luckily Tony had Yinsen there to implant an electromagnet in his chest to keep the shrapnel from reaching his heart. No telling what would have happened if he wasn't there!
How did you feel about them incorperating the Afghanistan war into the movie?

I thought it tied in well with the plot considering the Jericho demonstration is basically what set the plot in motion. So were you surprised to learn Obadiah was trafficking arms to criminals and staged a coup to replace Tony as the CEO?
For sure because how  elaborate must that plan have been.
Did you find Stark funny?
It was surprising! I found Stark to be a genius and playboy! I also love how they included agent Coulson and SHIELD into the movie!

I thought Downey was a great choice
 for Stark.
How did you feel about Pepper Potts's role in the movie.
Agreed. The entire cast was perfect for the roles they portrayed in my opinion. Even Paltrow as pepper potts.
I thought it was intense when Stane fell into the exploding reactor
Agreed. He clearly outmatched Tony as well!
Right, even though you know the good guy always wins, i felt like this fight kept me on the edge of my seat.
Same here! The fight taking them all the way to the top of Stark Industries building was awesome!
Yea I loved that Paltrow got to help  in some capacity. I always like a good love subplot.
Agreed.  She was a huge help in overloading the arc reactor. I can't believe Stark admitted he was Iron Man in the end. That was a surprise. How about you?
Same! I think this survey is letting us finish the conversation! Nice speaking with you!
Nice chatting with you about the 2008 superhero film Iron Man! Have a great day!

uid1response.feedback: It was hard to read so quickly and hard to talk about a movie I hadn't seen but I managed.

uid2response.feedback: Everything was perfect! I thoroughly enjoyed it! Thank you so much!
